main event: On November 11, 1967, an unidentified flying object was tracked on FAA radar over North Olmsted, Ohio, for approximately 3 hours and 30 minutes.
interesting points: The radar observed a target estimated at 5,000 to 7,500 feet, moving northwest at approximately 50 mph., The target vanished from radar approximately 3 miles from Buffalo., The controller suspected it to be a balloon but couldn't confirm any agency responsible for launching it., Wind velocity at high altitudes was significant, suggesting the object might have been carried by the wind., No visual sightings or photographs corroborated the radar data.
sighted object: an unidentified object tracked on radar
witness description: FAA radar controller who tracked the object.
